model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Speaker A, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: I have plan to make garden in my home. I want some suggestion from you.
Speaker B: Plum trees and pair trees would be my suggestion in the summer when they blossom they have such a lovely flower on them

[MEMORY]
Speaker B is an inventor working on a teleportation machine that is currently small and requires substantial energy sources. Speaker B is also interested in space exploration and plant science, expressing concerns about the fuels used for space travel. Speaker B is knowledgeable about plants and gardening, with a thriving garden. 
Speaker B is a fan of Beethoven and hopes to meet him by time traveling. Speaker B is working on a teleportation machine that is currently small and requires substantial energy sources. Speaker A is interested in nuclear energy and space exploration, mentioning fusion experiments. Speaker A struggles with gardening but finds the idea of space plants intriguing.
Speaker B is an inventor working on a teleportation machine that is focused on developing renewable energy sources for their inventions. Speaker B mentions weight gain from spending time at the computer and plans to work in the garden more. Speaker A struggles with gardening but finds the idea of space plants intriguing.
